intro: Kajuputi leucadendron, commonly known as the silver leucadendron, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its conical, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value comes from its striking foliage and long-lasting blooms.
